abstract: The question of whether humans have an innate set point for movement, a so-called activitystat, is of increasing interest and controversy among scientists.
snippet: The question of whether humans have an innate set point for movement, a so-called activitystat, is of increasing interest and controversy among scientists.
lead_paragraph: Does exercising at one point during the day make you less active the rest of the time?

headline.main: Do We Have a Set Point for Exercise?
